reviews.review: Im proabley about half way in.  No pun intended.  Anyways, So far its a really good game.  Im really glad i brought this game.

Mesmo só tendo comprado o jogo mais de uma década depois de seu lançamento, o sentimento de nostalgia não foi pequeno. Finalizei Half-Life 1 em meados de 2005 e sempre posterguei a aquisição da continuação da história. O jogo teve melhorias bem significantes em comparação com o primeiro game e conseguiu superar minhas expectativas. Agora é tomar vergonha na cara e terminar os episódios. Espero estar vivo para apreciar Half-Life 3 (caso seja lançado)

This game truly is as great as they say it is! I can't believe I haven't played this masterpiece sooner! This game has gotten me stumped, angry, killed, and scared a lot, but it was 100% awesome the whole way through! Although I may need to play Half-Life 1 and HL2's two episodes...

Pros:
-Amazing graphics! Not just by 2004 standards, it all looks great!
-Runs smoothly on my computer
-Has a shotgun
-Amazing characters
-Amazing challenges and puzzles
-Has a revolver
-The game is kinda long, or it was for me at least, but that's good!
-Has a crossbow
-Did I mention the weapons? [b]*ahem*[/b] shotgun, revolver, crossbow are my favorites [b]*cough*[/b]

Cons:
-I didn't get the ending. Maybe if I played the other Half-Lives... (Half-Li[u]f[/u]es or Half-Li[u]v[/u]es?)

Conclusion:
If you have Steam, $10, and a lot of time to kill, buy this game! Recommend it to your friends, your family, and your goldfish! Play it, finish it, and play it again! You won't be disappointed!
This is the best game I've ever played, there wasn't a single part where i wasn't having fun.
One of the best stories ever told. Shame Valve hasn't finished it yet.
half-life 3 plz

I cant believe I have never wrote a review for this! Okay, let me start by saying NOTHING that I am going to say in this review is nostalgia. I have gone back and replayed this game many times and even to this day Half Life 2 is a technological marvel! Everything in this game has been made to the best quality imaginable, even 13 years later most games can only hope to achieve a small portion of what this one has. There is a reason people have wanted Half life 3 for so long and it is indeed a good reason. The story is spot on, revealed piece by piece rather than a huge plot dump. The mystery and horror of an omni-present alien threat oppressing earth and its people after the events of Half Life force the player to live the events and feel the same emotions that the average man does and empathize with them. The gameplay is fun and intuitive with an array of original weapons ranging from the obvious SMG and Shotgun to the classic RPG, the exclusive "Gravity Gun" and of course the Half Life staple the crowbar! The atmosphere and design has been hand crafted to the max possible design making this one of the most realistic yet despairingly beautiful games ever made. Trust me, if you like shooters, you WILL love this game!
You'll be waiting for a conclusion as long as you'll be waiting for a purpose in life.
Classic PC game :)

Half life 2 is a very unique and exciting experience,the fact that you use interactive tools like having the ability to move objects around and having the zero-gravity gun are the most things that shape the experience in that game.
It's a kind of a horror/survival/FPS game. very very enjoyable :)

Ты. Если ты прошел эту игру - моё почтение!

Half-Life 2 - это самая что ни на есть классика жанра. Вышедшая в 1998 году, эта игра стала прорывом. На момент написания обзора на игру написано 11842 обзора, 96% которых положительны. Это ли не показатель.

Рассказывать об игре бессмысленно, ибо, как мне кажется, сейчас ее либо все прошли (кто хотел), либо не будут проходить вовсе (годы берут своё). Конечно, графон в игре не айс, но разве за графон мы любим халфу? Конечно нет.

Its good, but not as good as the first game. I don't know why I don't enjoy this as much, whether it's the upgraded graphics or the slower gameplay mechanics, but the first game was just a lot more enjoyable and fun. 


But this game is still pretty good, FPS mechanics are slick and the story is simple but still shows the post-apocalyptic horrors of the game. It still has the variety that HAlf-Life 1 had, which was the best part of that game and this game. It takes you from a densely populated city to a river marsh, to a freaktown, back to the city, through a desert and into the bloated end of the game.

The part that makes the game frustrating at some times is that you sometimes don't know where you have to go. This happens a lot in places like [spolier] Ravenholm, during the sequence in which a lot of headcrab zombies keep spawning; somewhat during the antlion buggy sequence; City 17's rebellion, Nova Prospekt and the ending Combine Lab. [/spoiler]


Although this game does have flaws and such, I would reccomend this game to people who enjoyed Half Life 1 and want to continue the adventure or people looking to play a solid FPS. However, I would rather reccomend something like Halo or Bioshock rather than this, but if you haven't played Half Life 1 then you should probably start with that.
Oynadığım en güzel oyunlardan birisi her yönüyle kendini öne çıkaran efsanevi bir yapım aşık olmamak elde değil almamak için bir tane sebep yok.

Kaosun ortasındayken G-MAN bizi alıp gene hapsediyor. Söyleme yetkilerinin olmadığını söylüyor, peki kim bu G-MAN'ın patronu. Half - Life 3'ü tüm insanlık istiyor. Fakat şöyle bir söylenim var. "Valve oyunların 3. serisini çıkarmıyor" eğer bu söylenti doğru olsa idi Doom 3 olmazdı. Valve insanların aklında kalmak ve asla gitmemek istiyor. Half-Life 3 gelicek, sabır etmeniz gerekiyor. En azından benim düşüncelerim öyle. Ama söylediklerim olmayabilirde, çünkü Half-Life 2 bitiminde ki emeği geçenler ve yapımcılar, ses düzenleyicileri vesaire yazılar geçtikten sonra bizlere Zen gezegeninden çıkan kafayengeçi saldırıyor. Silahımız yok kafamıza atlıyor. Belkide bir çok kişi bunu görememiştir bile. Demek istediğim şey Valve'nin konuşmaması bizim herşeyi oyundan çıkarmamızı istedikleridir. Belkide Half-Life 3 hiç çıkmayacak sebebi olarakta oyun sonunda ki yazılar geçtikten sonra bize lamarın ( kafa yengeçinin ) saldırması sonucu zombiye dönüşmüş olabiliriz ( Gordon Freeman ). Bütün bunlar bi ihtimal tabiki. Çıkacaksada acil çıksın, İngilizce öğretmenim bile oyunun 3. serisinin çıkmasını bekliyor. 1 - 2 sene önceki muhabbetimizde "Half Life diye bir oyun vardı, hala duruyormu devam ediyormu?" dedi. Half-Life 3'ü bekledik,bekliyoruz,bekliyeceğiz.

PREFACE: 

Before I write this review I have a confession to make; I had my first cup of coffee a couple of hours ago and my hands are sort of shakey!!!!
Seasoned reviewers know to base a game on the makers-intent and not the product, and I can say with one-hundred percent certainty that this game is excellent!

THE MEAT:
You are trapped inside Gordon Freeman. Shoot to kill and aim for the heart (a word of advice, WASD to move SHIFT to fast-walk). The gameplay mechanics are solid, Gordon Freeman never felt this animated and funny!

THE VERDICT:
similar to other games!!!
Half-Life, Гейб не любит тебя. Не то что я!
Classic

All I can say is that all those rebel NPCs who said "I'm following you, Dr. Freeman!" or joined my squad in the later stages should all have had to wear red shirts.  Cause their lifespan was measured in minutes after that.  Heck, I got more of them killed than I think the Combine forces did.

Despite having only one completion of this game under my belt, I think its safe to say this game is spectacular. It has some pretty dang fun combat, some pretty dang fun puzzles, and a story that can very easily knock your socks off. Its one of those rare moments where so much pride was taken by the devs that the game crosses the line from mere entertainment into art. 

I would say more, but I know people have already reviewed this game to death. I know anything I would say past this point has already been said. Half life Alyx just came out as of writing this, and while I'm disappointed that the latest installment was given a 1000 dollar price tag, I'm sure it carries the flag on well. This game means a lot to me and always will.

10/10

С выходом этой игры был презентован новый движок Соурс. Переработанный после пяти лет старичок уходящих девяностых QE и первой части данной игры.
Графика осталaсь минимальным эталоном и по сей день, хотя ей уже десяток лет.

Сам же сюжет игры порадовал, а также тоже самое русло в котором его преподносили. Согласен, что немного излишне приправили соплями в паре моментов и несуразицами, но это издержки производста и они настолько незаметны, что даже на общем фоне и упоминать не особо и хочется. Ведь всё подразумевало третью часть, да та самая горячо ожидаемая, что многое разьяснила бы и поставила на свои места.

Despite it being an old game and despite it being critically acclaimed to be one of the best damn games of all time, it just didn't cut the cheese for me. Time to review this blunt knife.

Compared to the original half life, I felt what half life 2 gained in atmosphere it lost in gameplay. Where as the original life life was challenging and action packed but lacking in logical environments, half life 2 felt like it was a slow paced tour of an apocalypse.

There are so many concepts under the half life 2 package that could've been expanded on so brilliantly, and with it could have kept its oppressive atmosphere up a little longer. 
Such as having you get past more checkpoints. see more oppression and overall actually fear the enemy before trying to worm you way out of a city overrun with dread.
It would have been more beneficial to allow the player to continue to feel the dystopia which was portrayed so strongly into the core at the beginning of the game.
It felt at first like it was you against never-ending swarms of emotionless, faceless troopers, where as in the end it felt something along the lines of a light bar brawl between a lepricaun and three drunk stormtroopers.
Instead of trying to switch out atmosphere with mediocre action scenes, it should have instead kept the oppression as a base and worked from that.

While the scenes themselves felt unique, the gunplay never felt impactful enough to relate to the original half life's action. I blame this partially on the poor weaponry sound design.
Puzzles being one of the core gameplay elements, I feel like they never did anything other than waste time walking from point a to point b. 
The only positives in this regard were the rewarding yet well-hidden lambda stashes strewn throughout the game.

My main problem with this is that unlike the first half life, where you were expected to rush into limited corridors to blast off foes, I felt that instead of feeling like you were weaving between the cracks, picking off squads of enemies and aliens, half life 2 gave the impression of running straight at the enemy without a care in the world, but only coming across the odd trooper who would miss you for fun.
There was so much potential in the portrayal of atmosphere and early action scenes that the mid and end game just felt mediocre in contrast, with relatively too few enemies to give any meaning to your characters forced blind bumble through various terrain.

I felt like a lot of emphasis was trying to be placed on individual enemies working together to overcome the player, but at the same time it was feared that the player would never succeed, so even on harder difficulties, the enemy combatants felt mediocre and forgiving.
There were no hidden strategies that made me think "aha! I could use This to push through these enemies!" it all just felt very A to B, unlike the first game which was willing to gameify itself enough to actually present fun challenges, such as the silly tripwire room and jumping platforms. 
Contrarily to this, it seems that half life 2 tried to be semi-realistic in the sense that it didn't want any "silly" scenes and opted for what was effectively mechanical repetition as far as the game mechanics are concerned. Once you beat your first duo of starting troopers, you've beaten them all.

I feel there was no trust in the player to push through the game on their own as the player's hand is held so much throughout the entirety of the game. The first part of action we think we may see and it's ruined by some "badass" npc trying to impress us with their ability to disarm soldiers in close quarters, then do nothing but climb for the rest of the game. 
Looking at you, Alyx.
The only thing I think this game did well is that the story concluded on a nice cliff-hanger and a quick twist that left a good element of mystery surrounding the game's ending.

TLDR: As an atmospheric shooter, this game should have been consistent with it's initially good atmospherical set-up and scene variance, bringing FPS gameplay into it through unique battles, too, instead of just unique scenes with copy-paste gunplay.

This is the game that, for me, changed my entire outlook on FPS gaming. I originally thought that it was nothing but endless kill sprees and bodies flying around...

Then this game showed up...

And HOLY CRAP DID I LOVE IT!

It has to be one of the most fun and innovative games of all time, not just for its revolutionary engine, but the story it provides and the characters you meet, and the physics puzzles that, overall, provides and entertaining, immersive, and downright fun experience. It changed my entire viewpoint of how the FPS genre is, and, while I also love endless shoot 'em ups, no FPS game has come close to entertaining me as much as Half-Life 2.

Overall, this is a classic that I would recommend for first-timers and experienced FPS gamers. 

10/10, would pick up that can again.
